Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2009 06:50PM marie111 wrote: Hello All, I am new here but have been following your thread ever since my hair feel out, it is very inspirational !! I finished 4XTC 4 weeks ago. My question is this: I never lost all my hair. When my hair started falling out I buzzed it with a #4 and what fell out fell out and a few stands stayed for the duration of my treatment. There is not much hair, it is VERY sparse and about 1/4 inch long. At this point - 4 weeks out - I am not really seeing any re growth. Should I shave my head right down ? Will this help it grow ? When it starts growing back is it a uniform growth ?  Also I am not taking anything for it any recommendations ? Thanks  ! Marie

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2009 06:02PM marie111 wrote: Am starting my chemo 4 X TC tomorrow !!! Solarbeam: Thank you for your encouraging words and deep down inside I fell the same. I DO NOT want to regret this later. I am also young,not quite as youg as you ;-( and want to do everything I can to be here a long time with my kids !! However it is still scary and I hate to this for nothing. I think we are still a few years to early for anyone to tell us for sure if it is beneficial or not for early stage ER + BC. So I guess I am jumping in with both feet (and maybe a little reservation) for what I hope will not be to wild of a ride .... Hope you are all well. Marie

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2009 09:26AM marie111 wrote: Madge24: Thank you for your encouragements. I see from your profile your scenario is very similar to mine. Can I ask why you are doing chemo? I see alot of women with early stage ILC not doing chemo. What was your tumor size? Did you do the Oncotype test and what was your result? My ONC recommends I do chemo because of my age (42) and tumor size (2cm) but my Oncotype result was 16 which is considered low. I have decided to do the chemo because I want to put all the chances on my side (I guess), still not sure I am making the right decision.... I am scheduled to start chemo on Thursday (4 X TC) ....

Posts.Title: Eyebrows marie111 marie111

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2009 02:40PM marie111 wrote: I can totally related to your turmoil right now as I have gone thru the same and still am.  I am 42 years o;d with two kids ( 8&10). I was  dx with stage 1, grade 1 or 2 (they can make up their minds) ILC with no node involvement. Doctors recommended I do the Oncotype test which I did and had a results of 16. So all my results are in the "GREY" zone but because of my age my ONC suggested I do the chemo and put all the chances on my side. This is what I did, yesterday I received my first chemo treatment. will be getting TC 4X. It was not without much sadness that I put my otherwise healthy body thru that experience but in the end I DO NOT want to have any regrets. I do fell I am doing everything possible to make sure this does not come back.  And even if I am reducing my chances of recurrence by only a few % points, well I'd rather be sure I did everything I could to fall in the no recurrence group. Hope this helps and good luck with your decision I know it's a hard one ... Marie
